title: Cardano Interop NOW
description: VCやDIDを使った分散型デジタル・アイデンティティはブームだが、インフラのボトルネックに直面している。カルダノのインターロップにより導入が加速する。

f6_assessments.q0:
The challenge is asking for a way to drive mass-scale adoption of DID usage as an easy-to-use onramp to the Cardano ecosystem.
The problem and solution statements are clear and reasonable.
The goal of having a Verifiable Credential platform and DID digital wallet that interops between Cardano and Hyperlink Indy aligns with the challenge objective.
The proposal is able to scale to drawing in millions of DID users.  
I concur with the proposal argument that this interoperability is required to become a leading provider of DID services. 
Based upon my experience, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has provided sufficient evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal in the form of references or links.
The team of has been sufficiently identified in terms of skills and number required to implement the proposal.
The budget is reasonable to achieve the goals and is broken down into identifiable items.
The timetable is realistic to complete the work and shows what is being done and when.
The plan describes the resources necessary to implement the proposal although it could be more detailed.
The proposal does not identify risks and challenges to a successful implementation although given the limited scope and existing solution there are no obvious significant risks.
Based upon my experience, I strongly agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides a roadmap with some auditable milestones and a defined timeline.
The proposal should include projected metrics that correspond to the challenge objective such as the number of DID users projected to be onboarded at specific time intervals and the recruitment cost per DID user.
The proposal should detail specifically how progress will be reported back to the Catalyst community at regular intervals.
Based upon my experience, I agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: Building infrastructure so Atala Prism can integrate with existing Veriviable Credential providers will provide oppertunity for Atala PRism to instantly onboard millions of users. In my opinion the proposal meets the challenge of building tech and marketure to onboard users to Atala Prism.
f6_assessments.q1: Although the team provided links to LindedIn and other websites, I feel the proposal requires further development to ensure successful implementation. I would like the team to expand on the responsibilities and deliverables of each member of the team, this allows insight on whether there is a work overload in one area. I advise the team to develop a risk assessment considering the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation, the team needs to think: "what needs to be true for this project to succeed".
f6_assessments.q2: The team provided a minimal roadmap and budget. I would like to see the team further develop and define monthly Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) for the project– set measurables for performance and use it as a KPI, then connect the KPI to the milestones on the project roadmap. I would like to see the budget developed beyond single line entries and broken down into monthly spending and connected to the monthly deliverables. By connecting the KPI's and roadmap milestones to the developer budget, the team can track performance and spending over a timeline . As the project stand at the moment, I feel the project will be challenging to audit.

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge asks how we can achieve mass adoption of DIDs and Prism. This proposal aims to to do that by creating a DID bridge between the hyperledger Indy and Cardano blockchains.

The problem statement doesn't call out a specific problem but makes a general statement about lack of infrastructure. The problem statement should be more specific. I think an improved problem statement would be "Cardano does not currently have DID bridges to other blockchains" which is much more specific and sets up the solution statement better. 

The solution statement is succinct but doesn't relate well the problem statement because the problem statement isn't well crafted.

The goals and metrics of this proposal are well aligned with the challenge. A cross blockchain DID/VC platform will certainly improve DID adoption and having an open source wallet which can interop between several blockchains is a great idea. I do wish a link to the existing product was provided.

This proposal I believe will be scalable assuming the DID/VC platform is well architected. The wallet should scale just fine and the underlying infrastructure of Cardano and Hyperledger will scale quite well.

I give this proposal a score of 4 because the problem statement isn't well crafted and some details about the existing product (which will be extended) are missing.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is highly experienced with decades (maybe even a century) of total experience. This is a very positive signal. The links to the LinkedIn profiles of the team is highly appreciated. 

The implementation plan is quite sparse though. Being an engineer myself (distributed systems, devops, and ML infra), I find it hard to believe that in 3 months an interblockchain DID protocol will be architected, developed and pushed into production with a comprehensive test suite (the test suite isn't mentioned but I believe inter blockchain tech should be well tested). Not only that, the team wants to build a DID/VC issuing platform and an opensource wallet. The team also wants the wallet to be multilingual and I know that internationalization is a difficult and tedious engineering process. The proposal doesn't mention which languages will be supported. The proposal also doesn't mention which tech will be used to make the mobile apps.

My opinion would be different if a link to the existing product was provided so that I can evaluate how far along the existing product is. I also took a look at the provided websites and I'm not impressed by the quality of tech there. They're quite simple websites with only a landing page and a contact us form. The websites do not match the entrepreneurial experience of the team.

It's not clear if the budget will last for the entire 12 months of listed work or if the team will request more funding in the future. 

The proposal doesn't outline a marketing plan - how will they gain "Stable & growing user base of digital wallet across Canada and India, including government orgs".

Overall, I strongly disagree that this proposal has a highly likelihood of successful implementation. I expect that a team of this caliber would have a much stronger proposal with more details.
f6_assessments.q2:
As stated in the impact portion of this assessment, the problem statement does not clearly identify a targeted problem. However, the solution statement does clearly state a solution.

This proposal provides a roadmap with 3, 6 and 12 month milestones but it's not clear if the requested funding is for the entire 12 months of work or just a portion. The milestones are clearly articulated but some of them are not precisely measurable. What does "Stable & growing userbase of digital wallet across Canada and India, including government orgs" mean? How can it be stable and growing at the same time? Growing at what rate? How many governement orgs? What distribution across Canada and India? What does "Commercial adoption of VC issuer/verifier platform in the US, Europe, and India" mean? How will commerical adoption be measured? Why isn't Canada in the list for commerical adoption but in the list for consumer adoption? How will we know if this wallet is "globally recognized as the most trusted digital identity wallet"? How do you measure trust levels across the globe?

"Digital wallet and issuer/verifier platform enables Cardano to compete as the preferred distributed ledger for the adoption of decentralized digital identity globally" is nonsensical. Cardano will compete regardless of whether this proposal gets funded. Cardano might not win without this proposal but it will be competing nonetheless.

One of the 12 month milestones are is good, it will be easy to verify if 10 mid-to-large size companies adopt the project. 

Overall, I give this proposal a score of 3 for auditability.
